page.title: 12CHILDRENS' GAMES
page.content: A large variety of games is played by children both at home and school. Here are just two. {Coloured eggs.}One person is the wolf, another the hen, the rest eggs. The eggs each choose a colour. The hen calls the wolf who comes across and knocks on her back asking if she has any coloured eggs. She tells him the colours. He calls one out; the egg of that colour has to run for home. If caught, she becomes wolf. {Kerbsy.}This is played by two people with a ball across a quiet road. The ball is thrown at the kerb. A two-handed catch gains two points, a one-handed catch three points. The first to a set total wins the game.
